intro: Centaurea bucharica, commonly known as the Bukharan centaury, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and bright blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, while the flowers are arranged in compact, conical clusters. Centaurea bucharica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
